All these things considered

":::"Immigrants and foreign students should have to decide whether to follow new customs or keep their <ins>old </ins>ones in their new countries. Both ways will offer important but different experiences for them. In this essay
column2:

On the one hand

column5: it will be <del>getting</del> much easier to make friends and get along well with the local people. Another huge benefit is that you will <mod target = less suffer>suffer less</mod> from conflicts caused by different ideas and easily recover from cultural shocks. A final point that comes with following the new customs is language acquisition. If you follow the new customs

On the other hand

column8: you will not forget your mother language and your original authentic <mod target = cultures>culture</mod>. Finally
column9: by constantly sharing the same cultural context with family members
column10: you will be able to continue to keep up a close relationship with your family
column11: friends
column12:
and relatives as well.

In conclusion

column14: I think that living by following the new customs is a better option than maintaining yours when you live in another country.  The benefits of helping <mod target = a language acquirement>with language acquisition</mod>

column16:
and making friends far outweigh the advantages of choice when keeping one's own customs.

learning about different fields can finally help learn or apply to the students' own field.

column15:
and how to solve problems when arguments occur. These activities are definitely helpful for students.

column1: 335&It is easier to maintain health today than in the past. Disagree or agree?:::"A large number of people might assert that it <mod target = is>was</mod> easier to maintain health in the past than <mod target = in>it is</mod> today. Contrary to popular belief
column2: I believe that it is <mod target = easeir>easier</mod> to sustain health today than in the past for two reasons: ability to deal with stress<del>
column3:
and economic abundance which helps people to be healthy in the modern era.

To begin with
column4: living in today's world enables people to deal with stress and thus maintain health. This is att<ins>r</ins>ibuted to the fact that living in the 21st century can distract people from worries and stress. It is obvious that there are more entertaining activities or facilities that distract people from worries and stress in <ins>the </ins>modern period than in the past. For instance
column5: <del>in </del>these days
column6: we can watch television programs such as <mod target = '>""</mod>American Idol<del>s</del><mod target = '>""</mod> and <mod target = '>""</mod>Dexter Series<mod target = '.>.""</mod> Therefore
column7: <mod target = this>these</mod> <mod target = simpel>simple</mod> and quick escape<ins>s</ins> from reality that <mod target = derived from>are the</mod> benefit<ins>s</ins> of <ins>the </ins>modern period may actually serve as a safety valve to let off some steam as well as a fun way to recharge energy. According to the Ministry of Education of Korea in 2010
column8: there was a significant difference between two groups of students in managing their academic pressure. Students in Group A<ins>
column9: </ins> who <mod target = are>were</mod> students in the 21st century<ins>
column10: </ins> were more satisfied with their school lives than those in Group B<ins>
column11: </ins> who were students in the early 20th century. This is especially true given the fact that in the early 20th century
column12: catastrophic events such as world war<ins>s</ins> frequently occu<ins>r</ins>red. Moreover
column13: students in Group B were involved in dangerous activities such as smoking
column14: drinking<ins>
column15:
and stealing to cope with their stress. This directly indicates that living in today's world makes people to be more healthy.

Furthermore
column16: life in the 21st century enables people to have happy and therefore healthier <mod target = life>lives</mod>. This is due to the fact that <del>in </del>these days there are more abundance in terms of finance<ins>s</ins>. To be specific
column17: the world's GDP in <ins>the </ins>1950s was approximately 40% of that of today's. <mod target = The money>Money</mod> tends to represent <del>their </del>power in society by showing their ability to attain whatever they want<ins>
column18: </ins> ranging from fancy cars to even trust in <mod target = realtionships>relationships</mod>. This is evident given the fact that modern society runs on materialism. According to the Ministry of Health and Welfare of Korea in 2009
column19: there was a huge difference between two groups of employees in <ins>the </ins>happy index. Employees in Group A <mod target = who is>were</mod> currently <del>a </del>working <mod target = man>and</mod> owned <del>a </del>house<ins>s
column20: </ins> and those in Group B <del>who </del>were working <del>man </del>in the mid-20th century <ins>and </ins>rented <del>a </del>house<ins>s</ins>. In the mid-20th century
column21: a number of people in the U.S. lost their home<ins>s</ins> because of the <mod target = bankrun>bankruptcy</mod> incidents and economy <mod target = crisis>crises</mod> that <mod target = was>were</mod> <ins>happening </ins>very often at that time. The researchers showed that the level of happiness of Group A was much higher than that of Group B. <mod target = The happiness>Happiness</mod> and health has <mod target = dicrect>a direct</mod> correlation <mod target = as>to</mod> stress that <ins>is </ins>derived from <ins>a </ins>lack of happiness<ins>
column22: which also</ins> weakens <ins>the </ins>immune system of <ins>the </ins>body. Moreover
column23:
more than 60 percent of the employees in Group B underwent severe depression. They constantly worried about paying rent in order to maintain a roof over their heads and to care their family. This shows that living in the modern epoch is more easier and happier.

In summary
column24: although many people argue that it <mod target = is>was</mod> easier to maintain health in the past than <del>in </del>today
column25: the benefit<ins>s</ins> of living in the present <del>time </del>far outweigh the benefit<ins>s</ins> of living in the past in terms of health. All in all
column26:
the importance of relieved stress and increased financial abundance in the modern era cannot be underestimated in order to have healthier lives.

column1: "339&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbor? Use specific details and examples in your answer.":::"There is a Korean proverb that says
column2: ""Neighbors are like cousins<mod target = "".>.""</mod> This means that neighbors are very important in our daily <mod target = life>lives</mod> and we should get along with them very well. But

column6:
I think the followings are the qualities we should have as good neighbors

First of all

column8: some people turn up the volume of their audio <ins>equipment </ins>to <mod target = an>the</mod> extent that their neighbors can hardly concentrate on their work<del>s</del>. This shows that they don't care about their neighbors. If these kinds of things continue to happen

column10:
which will be a cause of great stress for their every day lives.

Secondly

column12:
joys will be largely increased and sorrows will be greatly relieved.

Moreover

neighbors should help one another. Our neighbors might be sick and alone at night. Some criminals might intrude into our neighbors' houses. We should help our neighbors actively when they get in trouble. We can also be in the same situations.

In conclusion

column1:
"340&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbors? Use specific details and examples in your answer.

":::"In this <mod target = scoiety>society</mod>
column2:
it is commonly said that the term neighbor seems to be disappearing. It might be because people are focusing their concerns on themselves or their family instead of other people. And people started to feel that we don't need neighbors because they could interfere in our lives. But it is not a desirable phenomenon because neighbors can make our lives more precious. I am going to examine the qualities of good neighbors.

As a Korean
column3: I remember I was loved by many neighbors as well as my mother.<ins> </ins>There's a saying that <mod target = Nearby>nearby</mod> neighbors <ins>are </ins>sometimes <del>are </del>better than indifferent relatives. And I think <mod target = it>that</mod> is quite right. The first quality that a good neighbor should have is taking good care of their neighbors. I remember <mod target = onetime>once</mod> <del>that </del>my mom cook<ins>ed</ins> <del>a </del>food and told me<del> </del>
column4: <ins></ins>Take this food to <ins>the </ins>neighbors.<ins></ins> At that time I could't <mod target = understane mom>understand her</mod> but I realized that that's what neighbors are for. <mod target = Onetime>Once</mod> when I was young
column5: my mom had to go out to take care of something
column6: and I came home after school. <del>And </del>I had no keys and was very hungry
column7:
so one of my neighbors kindly cooked delicious food for me and lent me some toys so that I wouldn't get bored while waiting for my mom to come back.

I think the second quality that a good neighbor should keep is
column8: I think
column9: </del> <mod target = trusting neighbors>trustworthiness</mod>. As trust between people in modern society is disappearing
column10: it seems to be meaningless to say <ins>that </ins>about neighbors. Trust <ins>the </ins>people who are living right next to your house
column11: and then they will trust you too. That's how good relationship<ins>s</ins> between neighbors start<del>s</del>. My mom sometimes leave<ins>s</ins> a message saying<ins>
column12:
""Keys to home are next doors."" That means she left the keys to our house when we had to go out. Without trust we wouldn't leave the keys to next doors.

So far I mentioned 2 qualities that good neighbors should have. The first one is taking good care of his/her neighbors and the second one is trustworthiness. With good neighbors
column13: this dull society will be <ins>a </ins>better place to live and enjoy.":::

column1: "449&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbor? Use specific details and examples in your answer.":::"Nowadays

such as love of neighbors and a spirit of sacrifice.

First of all

column7: if we give some help or a present to our neighbors when they have a party

we can become a good neighbor.

Moreover

column12: when it is a day with much snow

it will be warm of many people'shearts.

In conclusion

column1: "450&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbor? Use specific details and examples in your answer.":::"As this society is getting more industrialized and urbanized
column2: people have a tendency to be more isolated and self-centered than <mod target = the good old ages>in the past</mod>. However
column3: we still need and appreciate a good neighbor. People say that neighbors are sometimes better than their own relatives who live <ins>far </ins>away from them. Some people think it is because they can share things while other people say it is because they have a heart of gold in this less personalized society. In my case
column4:
I think the qualities of a good neighbor are giving a hand and consideration for other neighbors.

First
column5: I think one quality of a good neighbor is<mod target =  a>the </mod>willingness <mod target = of giving>to give</mod> a hand when needed. I remember a close neighbor we had when I was young<del>
column6: </del> who <mod target = gave readily a hand>readily gave a hand</mod> when we needed. It was when my grandmother was discharged from the hospital and
column7: since grandmother didn't get well completely
column8: we needed someone who would give us a ride to take her back home. Thanks to our good neighbor's help
column9:
we were able to get my grandmother back safely.

Second
column10: </del> <mod target = another>Another</mod> quality that a good neighbor should have is consideration for others. For example
column11: there was a guy who lived next door during my high school years. He used to listen to <del>the</del> music very loudly and it annoyed me whenever I tried to study hard. A few days later
column12: I asked him if he could turn the volume down so that I could concentrate on my <mod target = study>studies</mod>. Because he was considerate enough to do as I <mod target = told>asked</mod> him
column13:
I was able to study better at home.

To sum up
column14: I think <ins>the</ins> qualities of a good neighbor are giving <ins>a </ins><mod target = hands>hand</mod> and <ins>having </ins>consideration for others. I believe everyone asserts that a neighbor who has these qualities is a good one and we ourselves can be a good neighbor by exercising these things to our own neighbors.":::

column1:
"766&Some people believe that students should be given one long vacation each year. Others believe that students should have several short vacations throughout the year. Which viewpoint do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.

avoid the bad words or conduct toward your kids and be patient.

column19: >.</mod> <mod target = although>Although</mod> I did not get much money

we can get some pivotal lessons.

In summary

Which do you think is preferable? Use specific examples to support your preference.:::"The ways of learning about life are various. They come from not only listening to the advice of family and friends but also personal experience. Both have advantages. Indirect experiencefrom listening to the advice of friends or family can make me reduce failure in life and my direct experience gives me my own ways to understand life.

One of the advantages of learning about life through friends or family is that I can predict what will happen to me and what I should avoid
column2: which reduces <mod target = mistake>mistakes</mod>.  My mother always said to me <ins>that </ins>visiting other countries was very <mod target = worthy>worthwhile</mod> because I could learn lots of things and that <mod target = affected>would affect</mod> my point of view positively. It was hard to save enough money to visit other countries and I <mod target = would rather buy cars>would have rather bought a car</mod> instead of visiting other countries. Nevertheless

my mother told me what was necessary and what was unnecessary. It was really useful. Learning about through family and friends is really worthwhile because it makes my life more safe and comfortable.

column9:
my country. She had lived in Bukyoung after the Korean War. It was shocked me and I started to think about the correlation between women and war. I still remember her face and her sorrow. In summary

column1: "958&Today, people's lives are much cozier and easier than the past.":::"As society <mod target = crossed>crosses</mod> the threshold of a new millennium
column2: humans have witnessed the advent of innumerable technologies and ideas that have enhanced the quality of our lives. Thus
column3: people are often under the impression that their lives have become better than the past. This common belief
column4: however
column5:
is a misconception in terms of loss of traditional values and the dangers posed by the development of technology.

Looking back to Korea's traditional community
column6: a value that dominated our culture was collaboration and staying in unison with neighbors.  With the emergence of a new idea
column7: individualism
column8: this firmly held belief was pushed out <del>our</del> <ins>of the</ins> way and people quickly took to the idea of living individual lives
column9: <del>less </del>caring <ins>less</ins> about others' point of view or conventional values imposed upon them by society. The new phenomena seemed novel
column10: since it freed people from having to work for the good of “the whole society” instead of pursuing personal interests. The enforcement of individual rights<ins>
column11: </ins> which was intended to make our society better
column12: nonetheless
column13:
has backfired in that it has led to a lack of empathy for others and the rampancy of apathy.

It is hard to deny that the development of technology has furnished us with a number of benefits
column14: including communicating with far flung families and friends through computer networks
column15: and traveling overseas conveniently through means of airplanes.  Nonetheless
column16: if we shift our viewpoint just a little
column17: it is easy to find that current technologies can be compared to a double-edged sword. To illustrate
column18: the advent of communication technology<ins>
column19: </ins> which allows us great convenience<ins>
column20: </ins> has opened floodgates to new types of crimes such as identity theft and computer hacking. Furthermore
column21:
social networking service have also been taken advantage of minority to manipulate the public's opinions and perspectives on certain issues.

The progress in technology in modern times has created a prevalent misleading idea that our lives are much cozier than the past. Although humans may be physically more comfortable
column22: with traditional values on the wane and new dangers menacing our society
column23:
it would be hard to confirm the validity of this widespread proposition.
